summary:
Baldr is a famous god from ancient Germanic stories, especially in Norse mythology. He is Odin's son and is known for his tragic death, which is a significant event in these myths. The stories say he had a powerful ship named Hringhorni and a beautiful hall called Breidablik. His wife was Nanna, and their son was Forseti.

Danish writers in the 12th century and Icelandic books from the 13th century tell stories about Baldr. These tales describe his death as a sad event that predicted the end of the world (Ragnar√∂k) in Norse beliefs.
title: Baldr
